Title: RHSA-2018:3059: X.org X11 security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Low)
Description:
X.Org is an open-source implementation of the X Window System. It provides the basic low-level functionality that full-fledged graphical user interfaces are designed upon.

Security Fix(es):

* libxcursor: 1-byte heap-based overflow in _XcursorThemeInherits function in library.c (CVE-2015-9262)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: unable to log out from vnc session
Xorg killed by SIGABRT after resize of VM display when multiple PCI device in use
Spice/QXL cannot support gnome3 with multi-monitors as it requires hardware acceleration
epoxy_glx_version & friends crash without GLX and hinder gtk3 startup
Segmentation fault in AnimCurCancelTimer with latest Xorg
libglvnd-1.0.1-0.6.git5baa1e5.el7 build is conflicting with mesa-17.2.3-8.20171019.el7
Unresolved symbol in the xorg-x11-drv-mouse driver
missing parameters in man page of Xvnc
gray screen and high cpu usage with vncviewer in fullscreen mode
vncviewer holds focus of whole screen after exiting fullscreen mode
CVE-2015-9262 libxcursor: 1-byte heap-based overflow in _XcursorThemeInherits function in library.c
wrong colours of VNC desktop via vncviewer on ppc64
Xorg defaults to clone mode if the monitor cable/connector can't handle the preferred mode
